= Testing your server implementation using echo_client.py in pywebsocket =

To connect to ws://example.com:12345/test using HyBi 00 version protocol, and send frames "Hello", "foo", "bar" to it, run this:

{{{
svn checkout http://pywebsocket.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ pywebsocket-read-only
cd pywebsocket-read-only/src
PYTHONPATH=. python example/echo_client.py -s example.com -p 12345 -r /test -m Hello,foo,bar --protocol_version=hybi00 --origin=http://example.com:12345/
}}}

You can add --log-level=debug to see verbose output for debugging.

= Testing your client implementation using standalone.py in pywebsocket =

To launch pywebsocket standalone server on port 12345 with echo back service on /echo with both HyBi 00 and Hixie 75 protocol support, run this:

{{{
svn checkout http://pywebsocket.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ pywebsocket-read-only
cd pywebsocket-read-only/src
PYTHONPATH=. python mod_pywebsocket/standalone.py -p 12345 --allow-draft75 -d example
}}}

Open http://localhost:12345/console.html using your client and check if the messages you send are echoed back.

You can add --log-level=debug to see verbose output for debugging.
